subject: Cybersecurity
title: Watering Hole Attacks: Poisoning the Well
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Watering Hole Attacks: Poisoning the Well.

hook.text: Instead of attacking you directly, they infect the website you visit every day.

buildup.text: Watering hole attacks compromise websites frequented by a target group â€” industry forums, news sites, tools.

discovery.text: In 2013, attackers infected an iPhone developer forum to target Apple engineers specifically.

twist.text: Victims never click a suspicious link. They visit a trusted site that was secretly compromised.

climax.text: Watering holes exploit the trust we place in routine. Our habits become the attack surface.

punchline.text: The trap isn't in your inbox. It's in your bookmarks.

quiz.question: What is a watering hole attack?
options: Compromising websites that targets regularly visit
